version_description:
New features:
- pandas is now included.
- keyboard extension bar improved, notably with tab key and shift-tab key.
- several bug fixes.

- open-in-place for directories: you can now access entire directories managed by other Apps. Click "Select" on the top left corner, click the circle next to the directory name, then click "Open". That's it. Carnets is now accessing the entire directory. This is great for notebooks that work with external datasets or that create files.
- remapping Caps-Lock to Escape for keyboards without an Escape key (see in Settings).
- the autocomplete pop-up menu works (use Tab).
- sliders in ipywidgets now follow touch events.
- new packages installed: networkx, cryptography, PyOpenSSL, asn1crypto, Pillow.
- pip updated to the latest version (19.1.1)
- the shutdown alert is now disabled by default. You can re-enable it (if you need to) in Settings.
- reduced the size of the installed App.
- fixed multiple bugs.

- open-in-place for directories: you can now access entire directories managed by other Apps. Click "Select" on the top left corner, click the circle next to the directory name, then click "Open". That's it. Carnets is now accessing the entire directory. This is great for notebooks that work with external datasets or that create files.
- remapping Caps-Lock to Escape for keyboards without an Escape key (see in Settings).
- the autocomplete pop-up menu works (use Tab).
- sliders in ipywidgets now follow touch events.
- shell commands can now be redirected. Try "%pip list | grep crypto" or "!ls -R > listFiles"
- new packages installed: networkx, cryptography, PyOpenSSL, asn1crypto, Pillow.
- pip updated to the latest version (19.1.1)
- the shutdown alert is now disabled by default. You can re-enable it (if you need to) in Settings.
- reduced the size of the installed App.
- fixed multiple bugs, improved stability.

- open-in-place for directories: you can now access entire directories managed by other Apps. Click "Select" on the top left corner, click the circle next to the directory name, then click "Open". That's it. Carnets is now accessing the entire directory. This is great for notebooks that work with external datasets or that create files.
- remapping Caps-Lock to Escape for keyboards without an Escape key (see in Settings).
- the autocomplete pop-up menu works (use Tab).
- sliders in ipywidgets now follow touch events.
- multi-character input keyboards (Chinese, Japanese and Hindi) now work.
- shell commands can now be redirected. Try "%pip list | grep crypto" or "!ls -R > listFiles"
- new packages installed: networkx, cryptography, PyOpenSSL, asn1crypto, Pillow.
- pip updated to the latest version (19.1.1)
- the shutdown alert is now disabled by default. You can re-enable it (if you need to) in Settings.
- reduced the size of the installed App.
- fixed multiple bugs, improved stability.

- open-in-place for directories: you can now access entire directories managed by other Apps. Click "Select" on the top left corner, click the circle next to the directory name, then click "Open". That's it. Carnets is now accessing the entire directory. This is great for notebooks that work with external datasets or that create files.
- improved user interface for iPhones with keyboard extension, picker menus.
- remapping Caps-Lock to Escape for keyboards without an Escape key (see in Settings).
- the autocomplete pop-up menu works (use Tab).
- sliders in ipywidgets now follow touch events.
- multi-character input keyboards (Chinese, Japanese and Hindi) now work.
- shell commands can now be redirected. Try "%pip list | grep crypto" or "!ls -R > listFiles"
- new packages installed: networkx, cryptography, PyOpenSSL, asn1crypto, Pillow.
- pip updated to the latest version (19.1.1)
- the shutdown alert is now disabled by default. You can re-enable it (if you need to) in Settings.
- reduced the size of the installed App.
- fixed multiple bugs, improved stability.

- open-in-place for directories: you can now access entire directories managed by other Apps. Click "Select" on the top left corner, click the circle next to the directory name, then click "Open". That's it. Carnets is now accessing the entire directory. This is great for notebooks that work with external datasets or that create files.
- improved user interface for iPhones with keyboard extension, picker menus.
- remapping Caps-Lock to Escape for keyboards without an Escape key (see in Settings).
- the autocomplete pop-up menu works (use Tab).
- sliders in ipywidgets now follow touch events.
- multi-character input keyboards (Chinese, Japanese and Hindi) now work.
- shell commands can now be redirected. Try "%pip list | grep crypto" or "!ls -R > listFiles"
- new packages installed: networkx, cryptography, PyOpenSSL, asn1crypto, Pillow.
- pip updated to the latest version (19.1.1)
- the shutdown alert is now disabled by default. You can re-enable it (if you need to) in Settings.
- reduced the size of the installed App.
- fixed multiple bugs, improved stability.
- iOS 13 compatibility, dark mode, fixed several issues that caused crashes
- added the lxml package, a prerequisite for many packages.

- added the bokeh package, for nice plots and figures.
- more progressive output from shell commands.
- user interface internationalization (French, Chinese): set up your language in "Settings".
- bug fixes

- Dark mode
- Download your notebooks as LaTeX, markdown, HTML...
- Visualize images, PDF, HTML files... directly in Carnets
- Request access to directory from the notebook page
- multiple bug fixes and improvements

- small bug fixes
- name change
- changed for the new "Developer Tools" category
- fixed a bug with saving notebooks

- In-app web browser. Need to look for information on a function, find a code example? You don't need to leave the App anymore. Click on the browser icon, enter the search terms or the URL, and get your information. The search engine can be configured in Settings.
- open other Apps from Carnets, using the shell escape "!openurl". For example, "!openurl shortcuts://" will open Shortcuts.
- fixes an issue with switching keyboards on iOS 14.
New Python modules: nltk, regex, wordcloud, cvxopt, pyFFTW.
